alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 6:52PM EST until March 05 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...The heaviest rainfall has ended...but flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana, Northern Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Dearborn, Franklin IN, Ohio, Ripley and Switzerland. In Northern Kentucky, Boone, Campbell and Kenton. In Ohio, Butler, Clark, Clermont, Clinton, Greene, Hamilton, Montgomery and Warren. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 652 PM EST, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing along some area roadways. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cincinnati, Dayton, Hamilton, Springfield, Kettering, Middletown, Beavercreek, Fairfield, Covington, Huber Heights, Fairborn, Mason, Florence, Xenia, Independence, Trotwood, Oxford, Miamisburg, Lebanon and Norwood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
